abbrev putnam_1988_a4_solution : Prop × Prop := sorry
-- (True, False)

\begin{enumerate}
\item[(a)] If every point of the plane is painted one of three colors, do there necessarily exist two points of the same color exactly one inch apart?
\item[(b)] What if ``three'' is replaced by ``nine''?
\end{enumerate}
-/

    (p : ℕ → Prop)

  sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1988_a4
    (p : ℕ → Prop)
    (hp : ∀ n, p n ↔
      ∀ color : (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)) → Fin n,
        ∃ p q : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2),
          color p = color q ∧ dist p q = 1) :
    (let (a, b) := putnam_1988_a4_solution; (p 3 ↔ a) ∧ (p 9 ↔ b)) := by

    · intro h

      <;> aesop

      <;>

          exact
            fun color => by
              use 0, 0
              simp_all [dist_eq_norm, EuclideanSpace.norm_eq])
      <;>
        aesop
  have h₁ : p 9 ↔ False := by
    simp only [hp]
    constructor
    · intro h
      have h' := h (fun x => ⟨0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0⟩)

      aesop
    · intro h
      simp_all
  simp [h₀, h₁, putnam_1988_a4_solution]
  <;> aesop
```

\item[(b)] What if ``three'' is replaced by ``nine''?
\end{enumerate}
-/
theorem putnam_1988_a4
    (p : ℕ → Prop)
    (hp : ∀ n, p n ↔
      ∀ color : (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)) → Fin n,
        ∃ p q : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2),
          color p = color q ∧ dist p q = 1) :
    (let (a, b) := putnam_1988_a4_solution; (p 3 ↔ a) ∧ (p 9 ↔ b)) :=
  sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1988_a4
    (p : ℕ → Prop)
    (hp : ∀ n, p n ↔
      ∀ color : (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)) → Fin n,
        ∃ p q : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2),
          color p = color q ∧ dist p q = 1) :
    (let (a, b) := putnam_1988_a4_solution; (p 3 ↔ a) ∧ (p 9 ↔ b)) := by
  have step₁ : p 3 ↔ False := by
    have h₁ : p 3 ↔ ∀ color : (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)) → Fin 3, ∃ p q : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2), color p = color q ∧ dist p q = 1 := by
      rw [hp]
    rw [h₁]
    have h₂ : ¬(∀ color : (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)) → Fin 3, ∃ p q : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2), color p = color q ∧ dist p q = 1) := by
      intro h
      have h3 := h (fun x => 0)
      obtain ⟨p, q, hpq⟩ := h3
      have h4 : dist p q = 1 := hpq.2
      have h5 : dist p q = ‖p - q‖ := rfl
      rw [h5] at h4
      norm_num at h4
      <;>
        simp_all [Fin.sum_univ_succ, EuclideanSpace.dist_eq, Real.norm_eq_abs, abs_sub_comm]
      <;>
        nlinarith [Real.sqrt_nonneg 2, Real.sq_sqrt (show (0 : ℝ) ≤ 2 by norm_num)]
    simp_all
  
  have step₂ : p 9 ↔ True := by
    have h₁ : p 9 ↔ ∀ color : (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)) → Fin 9, ∃ p q : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2), color p = color q ∧ dist p q = 1 := by
      rw [hp]
    rw [h₁]
    have h₂ : ∀ color : (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)) → Fin 9, ∃ p q : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2), color p = color q ∧ dist p q = 1 := by
      intro color
      use 0
      use 1
      simp [dist_eq_norm, EuclideanSpace.dist_eq, Fin.sum_univ_succ, Real.norm_eq_abs, abs_sub_comm]
      <;>
      norm_num
      <;>
      aesop
    simp_all
  
  simp_all [putnam_1988_a4_solution]
  <;>
  aesop
```
